acceptance_criteria:
AC1: Calculate approval rate disparity between groups
AC2: Return point estimate + 95% CI via bootstrap
AC3: Include p-value from permutation test
AC4: Handle binary and multiclass protected attributes
AC5: Validate against Fairlearn implementation

AC1: Calculate FPR and TPR disparity between groups
AC2: Handle missing ground truth (skip metric gracefully)
AC3: Bootstrap 10K iterations for CI
AC4: Validate against AIF360 implementation
AC5: Document when/when-not to use

AC1: Group predictions into probability buckets
AC2: Compare actual outcome rate across groups
AC3: Return max bucket disparity + per-bucket results
AC4: Validate against academic papers
AC5: Handle edge case (no samples in bucket)

AC1: Calculate FPR disparity only (not TPR)
AC2: Same CI/significance testing as other metrics
AC3: Document use case (high false positive cost)
AC4: Unit tests with ground truth validation

AC1: Bootstrap confidence interval computation
AC2: Permutation test for significance testing
AC3: Effect size calculations (Cohen's d, odds ratios)
AC4: Unit test coverage >90%
AC5: Validation against scipy/numpy implementations

AC1: POST /api/v1/fairness/test accepts test config
AC2: Validate required fields (model ID, data paths, attributes)
AC3: Async processing - return test_id immediately (202 Accepted)
AC4: Return estimated completion time
AC5: Clear error messages with remediation

AC1: GET /api/v1/fairness/test/{test_id} returns results
AC2: Include all metrics (values, CIs, p-values, interpretation)
AC3: Include remediation recommendations
AC4: Return report URL
AC5: Handle missing/invalid test_id (404 with guidance)

AC1: POST /api/v1/fairness/explain translates metrics to plain language
AC2: Context-aware prompting (data_scientist vs. compliance_officer)
AC3: Ground output in computed metrics (no hallucination)
AC4: Return explanation + key_takeaways + next_steps
AC5: Include business implications

AC1: EU AI Act Article 9 compliant template
AC2: Include model description, metrics, limitations, recommendations
AC3: Professional formatting (logos, color, tables)
AC4: PDF generation <30 seconds for 100K samples
AC5: Support custom audience (engineer vs. examiner)

user_story: Build job queue and async processing
acceptance_criteria:
AC1: Celery/RabbitMQ task queue integration
AC2: Support 10+ concurrent tests without degradation
AC3: Webhook callback on test completion
AC4: Retry logic (exponential backoff) for failures
AC5: Job status tracking (queued/processing/completed)

user_story: Implement data validation and attribute detection
acceptance_criteria:
AC1: Validate CSV/Parquet schema compliance
AC2: Auto-detect protected attributes in features (suggest names)
AC3: Warn on missing values, category imbalance
AC4: Clear error messages with remediation examples
AC5: Sample size warnings per subgroup

AC1: Test submission form (drag-drop file upload)
AC2: Status dashboard (view all running/completed tests)
AC3: Results viewer (metric values, confidence intervals)
AC4: PDF report download
AC5: Test history (past results, trend visualization)

AC1: Quick start tutorial (first test in 10 min)
AC2: Persona-specific guides (ML engineer, risk manager, compliance officer)
AC3: API reference with Python/cURL examples
AC4: FAQ (>10 questions answered)
AC5: Troubleshooting guide

AC1: Create 3-4 demo datasets (credit, fraud, insurance scenarios)
AC2: Include realistic bias patterns (known disparities)
AC3: Include ground truth labels
AC4: Document each dataset (size, bias explanation)
AC5: Host for download (GitHub, S3)

AC1: Interactive questionnaire (use case, constraints)
AC2: Recommend appropriate metrics based on answers
AC3: Explain metric tradeoffs (incompatible metrics warning)
AC4: Link to full metric guide
AC5: Save preferences for next test

AC1: EU AI Act Article 9 requirement mapping
AC2: ECOA disparate impact testing guidance
AC3: FCA fairness principles alignment
AC4: Singapore MAS FEAT framework coverage
AC5: Examples for each framework

AC1: Plain-language explanations for 4 core metrics
AC2: When/when-not to use each metric (use case guidance)
AC3: Academic references and citations
AC4: Case studies (credit scoring, fraud detection examples)
AC5: Decision tree for metric selection
